alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 01 at 9:20AM AKDT until November 02 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Visibility reduced to as low as one half mile. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Northeasterly winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From 1 PM Tuesday to 7 AM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall will begin Tuesday afternoon along the coast and quickly push inland. Snow will combine with intensifying northeasterly winds to reduce visibilities through the overnight hours. Winds and snowfall rates will diminish in tandem Wednesday morning, putting an end to the threat.
info.instruction: There will also be potential for reduced visibilities as heavy snowfall rates combine with gusty easterly winds to produce blowing snow. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
